etymology.description: Depicts a graphic sign 𠃊 to symbolize something that hides something or someone
etymology.interpretation: The character 匸(xì, "enclosure") depicts a shape resembling a lid or cover, suggesting something that closes or conceals a space.
etymology.simplification: None, since 匸(xì, "enclosure") is both the simplified and traditional form.

examples.chinese: 学者研究匸的结构(學者研究匸的結構)，认为其代表一种围合概念(認為其代表一種圍合概念)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě yánjiū xì de jiégòu, rènwéi qí dàibiǎo yī zhǒng wéihé gàiniàn.
examples.english: Scholars study the structure of the enclosure, believing it represents a concept of encapsulation.

examples.chinese: 古籍记载匸的演变(古籍記載匸的演變)，体现古人智慧(體現古人智慧)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔjí jìzǎi xì de yǎnbiàn, tǐxiàn gǔrén zhìhuì.
examples.english: Ancient texts record the evolution of the enclosure, reflecting the wisdom of the ancients.
